Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Village Panturli, SC Kudase, PHC Talkat, Taluk Dodamarg. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 09 samples collected for Malaria at PHC Talkat were negative for malaria and positive for KFD. Rapid fever survey and use of Larvicides for Tick control was done. All cases treated locally. Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Dongarpal. SC Netarde, PHC Banda, Taluk Sawantwadi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 18 samples tested at PHC Talkat were negative for Malaria. 05 samples sent to Manipal Laboratory, Udapi were positive for KFD. All cases treated symptomatically. Source reduction, larval survey and other vector control measures were done.

Case reported from Village B Kanburu/Jogimakki, PHC/CHC Balehonnuru/Kattinamane, Taluk NR Pura, District Chikkamagaluru. Case presented with fever and weakness.One blood was sent to VDL, Shivamogga and six blood samples from suspected cases and Monkey necropsy samples were sent to VDL, Shivamogga. One blood sample was found positive for KFD by IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Fever survey was done. Health education was given.

Cases of fever reported from several PHCs of Block Thithahalli, Distt Shimoga. A total of 112 cases and no deaths were reported since 5 Jan 2015. District RRT investigated the outbreak and house to house fever survey done. A total of 112 blood samples tested; 32 samples were positive for KFD by PCR at NIV Pune. Few monkey deaths were also reported from affected area. All cases had history of going to forest for different purposes. 72 tick samples were also collected and sent to NIV Pune; result awaited. Vaccination against KFD was done in the community and tick repellant oil (DMP) was distributed. Health education given regarding personal protection.
Cases 24 Monkey specimens sent symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Villages Thirunelli, Thrisseleri, SC Aranapara and Bavali, PHC Appapara, Block Manathavady. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 2 serum samples collected and sent to MCVR were positive for KFD virus (PCR Positive). Surveillance of monkey death surrounding 2 Km of affected area was carried out. 350 doses of KFD vaccine procured from Shimoga and vaccination done in the affected area. Tick surveillance done in monkey death reported areas and collected ticks were send to NIV Pune; result awaited. BB emulsion distributed in affected area. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Amaikulam, HSC Marapalam, UPHC Nelliyalam, Block Gudalur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 1 serum sample collected sent to MCVR Gudalur GH; was positive for KFD Positive. Symptomatic treatment given. Health education given.

Case reported from Mananthavadi, PHC Begur, Panavalli, Thirunelli, District Wayanad. The case was a 24-year-old male who was engaged coffee bean plucking in the nearby forest. He presented with developed loose stool and was admitted to the local hospital for further diagnosis and treatment. 01 blood investigation, Kyasanur Forest Disease by RT PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.in fever and myalgia, later he sample was sent for further it was found to be positive for

Case reported from Mananthavadi, PHC Begur, Panavalli, Thirunelli, District Wayanad. The case was a 24-year-old male who was engaged coffee bean plucking in the nearby forest. He presented with developed loose stool and was admitted to the local hospital for further diagnosis and treatment. 01 blood investigation, Kyasanur Forest Disease by RT PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.in fever and myalgia, later he sample was sent for further it was found to be positive for

Cases reported from Village Gejjenahalli, PHC Harnahalli. Cases presented with fever, vomitting and bodyache. District RRT investigated the outbreak and house to house active case surveillance was done in affected area. DMP Oil was distributed among the households and health education was given on the nature of the disease and its preventive measures.
Cases reported from- SIDDAPUR Taluk, Bilagi PHC, HALAGERI Village. Case presented with headache and fever. The deceased case was an 85 year old female. Patient was found positive for KFD by RTPCR.

Outbreak reported from Villages/PHCâ€™s Konandur, Kannagi, Malur, Block Thirthalli, District Shimoga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Affected villages are surrounded by forest. 2 deaths of monkey were reported. People go to forest to collect fire wood. Agriculture is the main occupation of the community. Out of 35 serum samples collected and sent o NIV, Pune, 12 samples were positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease (RT PCR). Gram Panchayat was sensitized regarding prevention and control measures. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Cases of fever and body ache reported from Village/PHC Noolpuzha, SC Muthanga, Block Bathery, District Wayanad.District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. All affected cases are female workers with history of working in forest area and tick bites. Out of 7 blood samples tested 1 was positive for KFD. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Outbreak reported from Villages Hadigallu, Bandikoppa, Banvikaisaru, Tanigebylu, Kannangi,Ganimakki,Dobylur Bellur ,Jaddinagadde, PHC/CHC Thirthalli , District Shimoga .District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Affected villages are surrounded by forest. Monkey deaths were reported .People go to forest for collection of wood and agriculture is the main occupation of the community. 86 serum samples sent to NIV, Pune; result awaited. Gram Panchayat was sensitized regarding prevention and control measures. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Current Status: Cases reported from Block Chungathara, Village /PHC/ SC Karulai, district Malappuram. All cases were reported from tribal area of a reserve forest. The cases tested positive for KFD at NIV Pune by Ig M ELISA and RTPCR. All the cases were above 15 years of age. House to house survey done to find new cases.

Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Bappamane Village, Mathimane Sub-centre, PHC Sampekatte, Hosanagara Taluk, Shimogga District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. The affected age group was 0-30 years. Total 81 samples were sent to VRDL Shimogga, out of which 5 samples were positive for KFDV IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on reporting of monkey deaths in their area to health department and self-protection measures like wearing full clothing while going to forest area, bathing after return from work, use of tick repellents. KFD active surveillance and preventive activities were initiated in all the villages around 5 km radius aerial distance. DEPA was distributed. Strengthening IEC awareness among Medical officers and health staff was done. Death of an 18 year old female has occurred due to the illness on 08-01-2024 at KMC Manipal due to Bilateral Pneumonia with Septic Shock; KFD Encephalitis with MODS.

Cases reported from 60 villages & 7 PHC, Beetabasavani PHC, Tirthahalli Taluk, Shivamogga. District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with myalgia. All age groups were affected. Total 297 suspected cases tested for KFD at VRDL Shivamogga, out of which 6 were positive for KFDV by RT-PCR. Two monkey & 42 tick pool samples were tested, which were found to be negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. Active surveillance in the entire taluk was done with house-to-house visit, line listing of all fever cases, referring to PHC, collection of samples at PHC, distribution of DEPA oil and providing IEC. Medical officers were instructed to conduct coordination meeting with PDOs, Forest and Veterinary officers and constituting Monkey autopsy committed at each GP.

Cases reported from 6 villages & 1 PHC, Avinahalli, Tumari, Kagodu, Byakodu, Tyagarthy Village, Kagodu PHC, Sagar Taluk, Shivamogga District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with myalgia. All age groups were affected. Total 53 suspected cases tested for KFD at NIV Pune, out of which 2 were positive for KFDV by RT-PCR. Two monkey & 42 tick poop samples were also tested, which were found to be negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. Active surveillance in the entire taluk was done with house-to-house visit, line listing of all fever cases, referring to PHC, collection of samples at PHC, distribution of DEPA oil and providing IEC. Medical officers were instructed to conduct coordination meeting with PDOs, Forest and Veterinary officers and constituting Monkey autopsy committed at each GP.

Cases reported from 5 PHCs (PHC Biligi, PHC Koralkai, PHC Kolsirsi, PHC Herur and PHC Kyadgi) and 8 villages of Siddapur Taluk, Uttar Kannad District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with myalgia. A total of 16 monkey deaths were also reported from the same Taluk. All age groups were affected. Total 310 suspected cases tested for KFD at VDL Shivamogga, out of which 40 were positive for KFDV by RT-PCR. Five tick pool sample were also tested, which were negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. IEC activities were initiated, distribution of Depo oil in the affected area of the village Nipli and Mandgalale was done. Information was given about Kyasanur Forest Disease in both the villages. Blood samples of suspected people were collected and sent for testing. Fever survey and reporting was initiated. Ticks from the affected area were collected and samples were sent for the testing.

Cases reported from Bintravalli, OLV estate, Nuggi, Jogisara, Devana estate of Balagadi SC & Berukodige, Mysore plantation, Karadihitlu, Bivinlok, Devana estate and Hosuru villages of Bappunji SCs which belongs to Koppa Taluk, Chikkamagalur District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, head ache and mild weakness. Total 60 blood, 1 monkey & 11 tick samples were sent to VRDL Shivamogga, out of which 25 blood samples were positive for KFDV by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on reporting of monkey deaths in their area to health department and self-protection measures like wearing full clothing while going to forest area, bathing after return from work, use of tick repellents. KFD active surveillance and preventive activities were initiated in all the villages around 5 km radius aerial distance. DEPA was distributed. Strengthening IEC awareness among Medical officers and health staff was done.

Cases reported from Melukoppa, Village, Begane Village of Begaru SC, Begaru PHC of Sringeri Taluk, Chikkamagaluru District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever and body ache. Total 13 blood & 7 tick pool samples were sent to VRDL Shivamogga, out of which 1 blood sample was positive for KFDV by RT- PCR & all 11 tick pool samples were negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on reporting of monkey deaths in their area to health department and self-protection measures like wearing full clothing while going to forest area, bathing after return from work, use of tick repellents. KFD active surveillance and preventive activities were initiated in all the villages around 5 km radius aerial distance. DEPA was distributed. Strengthening IEC awareness among Medical officers and health staff was done. Death of a 79 year old male has occurred due to the illness.

Case was reported from Village Kenchanoor, Sub-District Kundapura, District Udupi. Case presented with fever with generalized weakness. 1 blood sample was collected and sent to VRDL Shivmogga. Sample came positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease (KFD) Virus by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Case was treated at KMC Manipal. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Kasegadae Navilgar Village & Hattargi Village, Revankatt PHC, Sirsi Taluk, Distrck Uttar Kannada. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with myalgia. All cases screened were in same community as suspected cases & were tested as Epidemiologically linked. Total 139 samples were tested for KFDV by RT-PCR, at VDL Shivamogga, out of which 5 were found to be positive. Three tick pool samples were also tested, which were negative. No monkey death was seen. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on Kyasanur Forest Disease in both the villages. Initiated IEC activities, distributed Depo oil in the affected area. Also initiated fever survey and reporting. Death of a 66 year old male has occurred due to the illness (positive for KFD).

Cases reported from Hattikeri, Village, PHC Hattikeri, Ankola Taluk, Uttrakannada District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with myalgia. Total 133 samples were tested for KFDV by RT-PCR, at VDL Shivamogga, out of which 1 was positive. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on Kyasanur Forest Disease in both the villages. Initiated IEC activities, distributed Depo oil in the affected area. Also initiated fever survey and reporting.

Cases were reported from Village Ambolli, Sub-District Supa, District Uttar Kannad. Case presented with fever with generalized weakness. 202 blood samples were collected and sent to VDL Shimoga. 2 Samples came positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease (KFD) Virus by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Hivrem and Golaulim, Sub-District Satari, District North Goa. Case presented with fever, headache with generalized weakness. 65 blood samples were collected and sent to DPHL North Goa. 6 Samples came positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease (KFD) Virus by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Age group of the affected cases were 35-50 years. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Alegoudanakatte area, Maddur range, Gundlupet, District Chamarajanagar. State RRT investigated the outbreak. 10 monkeys died from 16th to 30th November 2012 and first human case was reported on 23rd November 2012. Out of 6 serum samples collected, 3 were positive for KFD. All cases treated. Vaccination done to forest workers. Repellent lotions DMP were distributed to forest workers and tribal people. IEC done.

Case reported from Village Thrisseleri, HSC Bavali, PHC Appapara, Block Manathavady. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Fever surveillance conducted in the affected area. The case was a 27y/F who developed fever and loose stools. Her house is surrounded by coffee estate and monkey deaths were reported from the same area. A single sample collected and sent to MCVR, Manipal was found positive for Kyasanur Forest Disease by PCR. Case treated. KFD vaccination campaign conducted in the affected area. Tick surveillance conducted in all monkey death reported areas. Health education given.

Cases Talukreported from PHC/CHC Kumbarwada, Joida. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 blood sample collected and sent to VDL Shivamogga; were positive for KFD (IgM ELISA). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases Talukreported from PHC/CHC Kumbarwada, Joida. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 blood sample collected and sent to VDL Shivamogga; were positive for KFD (IgM ELISA). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Outbreak was reported in week 53rd (week ending 3rd January 2016.A total of 154 cases have been suspected for the disease as on 21st March 2016. Two Isolated cases are found each at Santa Cruz, Ponda and Savoiverem, Ponda Goa which are at a distance of around 30-40 km from the affected area (Sattari Goa).15 Monkey Necropsy Samples of suspected cases were sent to National Institute of Virology, Pune , out of which 10 are tested positive for KFD. Vaccination was started at Community Health Centre, Valpoi from 04/03/2016 & Primary Health Centre, Dharbandora from 17/03/2016. Total 3177 people are vaccinated till 21-3-16.

Case reported from Village Dabem, CHC Valpoi, Taluka/Block Sattari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. One Serum sample tested at MCVR, Manipal, found positive for KFD by IgM Elisa. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Hivrem, CHC Valpoi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Serum sample tested positive for KFD, at MCVR, Manipal. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
